definition: car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: I'm the first guy to drive long-distance on Mars.
sentences.chinese: 我是第一个在火星上开长途车的人。

sentences.english: The coach driver was seriously hurt.
Good morning. How did you sleep after your long bus ride?
sentences.chinese: 早上好。坐了长时间的长途车后，你睡得怎么样？

sentences.english: A coach crashed into a tree last night.
sentences.chinese: 一辆长途车昨晚撞上了一颗树。

sentences.english: But it takes only 5 minutes to walk from the long distance coach station to the hostel.
sentences.chinese: 不过，从长途车站到旅店步行也只要5分钟。

sentences.english: We can get there by coach.
sentences.chinese: 我们乘坐长途车能到达那里。

sentences.english: We can get there first by coach and then by cable car .
sentences.chinese: 我们先乘长途车然后再坐缆车能到那里。

definition: to take the car, bus, train etc
to transfer/to change trains, buses etc
green train (slow, noisy, unairconditioned train with forest green livery and yellow trim that ran on the Chinese railway system from the 1950s, phased out in the early 21st century)
power car/multiple-unit train (abbr. for 動車組|动车组)
bus/abbr. for 公共汽車|公共汽车[gong1 gong4 qi4 che1]/car belonging to an organization and used by its members (government car, police car, company car etc)/abbr. for 公務用車|公务用车[gong1 wu4 yong4 che1]
to transfer/to change trains, buses etc
departure (of a coach or train)/to dispatch a vehicle
local bus or train/slow train with many stops
